result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (6th) and Operating w/ PAC (6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Howard C. McDougal was found guilty of OWI (6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Howard C. McDougal was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Paid in full - bond previously posted has been applied.

superMiscConds.notes: The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant to comply with any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

records.addlTxt: Combined Information - Waushara Co 14CF68 & Green Lake Co 13CF91

Case called @ 2:07 p.m. Defendant Howard C. McDougal in court with attorney Kirk William Everson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Application for consolidation of Green Lake County Case 13CF91 to Waushara County.  Defendant waives his right to have the case heard and tried in Green Lake County. Court accepts voluntary application for consolidation of the charges in Green Lake County to Waushara County. 14CF68 - The court entertains voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1(Waushara 14CF68 - OWI 6th) - NC. Ct 4 (GLSO 13CF91 - OWI 5th)- NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 3 - DRI. Cts 2 & 5 - Dismissed outright. The parties are not requesting a PSI. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the PSI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Everson. No statement by DE. 

Court orders: Ct 1 -  5 yr term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 2 yr IC/ 3 yr ES - Concurrent with Ct 4 - 3 days CFTS. ES Conditions:  AODA and follow through, Abs Sob, Not be on the premises of any bars, defendant is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances not prescribed by a physician, 36 mos DL rev/ 36 mos IID, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, OWI Assessment, $3000 fine inclusive of costs - Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is not eligible for CIP Defendant is eligible for SAP.

Court orders: Ct 4 - 4 yr term of imprisonment - Bifurcated SEH - 1 yr IC/ 3 yr ES - Concurrent with Ct 1 - 3 day CFTS. ES Conditions:  AODA and follow through, Abs Sob, Not be on the premises of any bars, defendant is prohibited from ingesting any impairing substances not prescribed by a physician, 35 mos DL rev/ 35 mos IID, Any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by supervising agent, OWI Assessment, DNA Sample and surcharge, $2500 fine inclusive of costs - Costs to be paid from up to 25% of inmate earnings during IC. Defendant is not eligible for CIP. Defendant is eligible for SAP. Bond previously posted to be applied. Cash bond revoked and the defendant is remanded to custody. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Case Called @ 1:51 PM: Defendant Howard C. McDougal in court with attorney Kirk William Everson.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA:  Believes this matter is resolved however, Green Lake Co charges not consolidated yet with paperwork.  Changes in State's attorney in Green Lake have hampered consolidation efforts.  DA requests add'l 30 days.  Atty Everson confirms State's recital.  Court requests add'l discussions with Def as to the nature of his wife's employment in Green Lake Co.  Off Record for counsel to speak with Def.  Back of Record at 1:55 PM:  Def is agreeable to waive any judicial conflict.  Court accepts waiver of any potential judicial conflict based upon wife's employment.  Application and Consent to Consolidate should be forthcoming. Court and counsel concur that Consolidation to be completed prior to plea - Amended 4 Count INFO.  Waiver, ARGN and P/S to be conducted at next hearing scheduled.  Single INFO to be filed in Waushara that brings in Green Lake charges into one single document.  Counsel do not intend to request PSI however, argued terms on sentencing. Def advised of the requirement of immediate reporting following sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Case Called @ 2:33 PM: Attorney Kirk William Everson in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per Atty Everson:  Def found competent to stand trial, consolidation ongoing and will request Green Lake matter will be consolidated into Waushara Co.  Court reminds counsel that Green Lake Complaint will need to be made a part of Waushara's record.  Single information is helpful subsequent to consolidation with consent from Green Lake and Defendant as well.  Atty Everson states there will be no contested issues for sentencing.  1/2 hour reserved for Sentencing due to both counties and paperwork involved.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on July 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

3:06 pm case called. Defendant Howard C. McDougal in court with attorney Kirk W Everson.  Steven P Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Preliminary Hearing and time limits discussed. Defendant waives time limit for preliminary hearing. Court accepts waiver of time limit for preliminary hearing. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Status conference scheduled for July 16, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

No operation of any motor vehicles whatsoever.  Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.

Case called @ 1:16 p.m. Defendant Howard C. McDougal in court, in custody, appears via video.  Scott C Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. Defendant will be privately retaining Kirk Everson. DA Blader requesting $5000 Cash Bond. Statement by DE regarding bond. Court orders $5000 Cash Bond.   IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 02:45 pm.
